intro: Hoeckia, commonly known as the stonecress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically found in arid or rocky habitats, showcasing their adaptability to harsh environments. They are characterized by their small, delicate leaves and bright yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Hoeckia species often have a compact growth habit and are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants. Their seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, aiding in their spread across various regions.
